snippet: Members of Congress said the N.F.L. players union’s longstanding efforts to question the science behind the H.G.H. test was simply a way to “run out the clock.”
abstract: Bipartisan group of lawmakers vents its frustration at the NFL players' union for not yet agreeing to put into effect a test for human growth hormone nearly two seasons after promising to do so.
lead_paragraph: Members of Congress said the N.F.L. players union’s longstanding efforts to question the science behind the H.G.H. test was simply a way to “run out the clock.”

headline.main: Lawmakers Chastise Union for Not Moving Forward on H.G.H. Testing
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Chastise Union for Not Moving Forward on H.G.H. Testing

keywords.value: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
keywords.name: organizations
